description: Dive into "Castles of Enchantment in Palma de Mallorca" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Castles of Enchantment in Palma de Mallorca

places.generalDescription: The Royal Palace of La Almudaina, a stunning blend of history and architecture, is located in Palma, right next to the iconic cathedral. Originally an Arabian fort, it was transformed into a royal residence by King Jaume after the Christian conquest in 1229. This magnificent palace serves as one of the official residences for the Spanish royal family and showcases various areas open to visitors.

sources.shortName: 10 best things to do in Palma de Mallorca

sources.snippet: The Royal Palace of La Almudaina is a summer residence of the King of Spain in Palma. The 14th-century alc√°zar (an Islamic palace in the Iberian Peninsula) shows artistic styles that have succeeded each other in the history of Mallorca. Together with the Palma Cathedral it is a historic landmark on Mallorca.

places.name: Royal Palace of La Almudaina

reviews.text: It was worth a visit, if you go therr i recommend using an audio guide because it definitely makes the visit better, we didn't take it but if i would go again i would. If you are an EU citizen you can also go there between some hours that are listed at the entrance to get a free ticket. I suggest you look into it before you go, so you don't have to pay for the ticket. Otherwise it was very pretty the view is amazing and the palace is really interesting. We just walked around the place and we needed 45 minutes so i think it would take longer if we had an audio guide.

The building itself and architecture is of course stunning, but the rooms are pretty much empty with only a few tapestries and cabinets on display and no information provided about them. We weren't aware until after our visit that an audio guide is available so perhaps this information is in that guide. The star I deducted was for the attitude of the staff. I felt like it was a chore for the girl at the desk to even sell us the tickets and the 2 security men that put our belongings through the xray machine looked like they were sucking lemons and couldn't care less.

Absolutely stunning place! The Royal Palace of La Almudaina is full of medieval charm and history. The architecture is impressive, with beautiful stone halls, grand rooms, and amazing views of the sea from the upper levels. It feels like stepping back in time. Everything is well preserved and the atmosphere is truly majestic. A must-visit in Palma for history and architecture lovers!

places.address: Carrer del Palau Reial, s/n, Centre, 07001 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain

places.generalDescription: Castell de Bellver, a 14th-century circular castle commissioned by James II of Aragon, sits atop a wooded hill overlooking Palma. Initially built as a royal residence, it later served as a military prison. Today, the castle houses the City History Museum showcasing Mallorca's history through various artifacts and exhibits. Visitors can enjoy panoramic views of Palma and its bay from the top of the castle while surrounded by fragrant pine woods.

sources.snippet: Bellver Castle is a 14th century castle in Palma de Mallorca. The Gothic-style castle was built for King James II of Majorca and it‚Äôs unique because of its circular shape. It was the residence for the Kings of Majorca and it was later used as a military prison.

places.name: Castell de Bellver

reviews.text:
The castle is visible from many places in the city. We purchased the castle entrance tickets as part of the City sightseeing bus tour. Collect your ticket at the window by showing your receipt.

You can easily take the stairs. If you prefer to access the ramp entrance, it is further along the roadway. It's steep and a bit of incline.

Look for a kiosk sign with an I. It has a map in Spanish but easy to follow. The map is pertinent to the bottom floor of the castle. Lots of storyboards in  multiple languages, including English.

There's also a historical timetable of the city that is equally interesting, along with maps.

Washrooms are available throughout that are quite clean. Be sure to bring water as it can very warm walking the multiple floors. FYI- no place to sit where the sun is out, so come prepared!

Highly recommend a visit to the castle!

The place itself is stunning, but unfortunately, it's not open to visitors from the inside. It's located at the top of a hill, so if you're coming by bus, you'll have to climb the stairs. It's almost like a little hike! Each step you take brings you closer to the fort, and you'll get a breathtaking view of the sea and the city from the top. There are plenty of sitting benches available to rest, grab a snack, or take some amazing photos. It would have been so much better if we could have entered the fort, but it's still a beautiful place to visit.

Bellver Castle is a truly impressive sight. We arrived a bit late and missed the chance to go inside (it closes at 7pm in the summer), but even from the outside, the circular Gothic architecture is stunning.

The real highlight, though, is the location. Situated on a hilltop, the castle offers an absolutely breathtaking panoramic view of Palma and its bay. It's the perfect spot to capture some incredible photos and just take in the beauty of the area. It's worth the trip up the hill just for the views alone.

places.address: Carrer Camilo Jos√© Cela, s/n, Ponent, 07014 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain

sources.snippet: It is the only circular Gothic castle in Spain, with its three original towers and the additional Torre del Homenaje (Tower of Homage), which lend elegance to its design as a stone fortress.
sources.shortName: Bellver Castle - The best views of Palma

places.name: Torre del Homenatge

(Translated by Google) High castle tower at the circular castle. Photogenic.

places.address: Carrer Castell de Bellver, Ponent, 07014 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain

sources.snippet: Bellver Castle is one of the stops on the route on the open top bus tour ‚Äì Palma City Sightseeing. There are many ways to get there, but the most interesting is to walk up through the beautiful scenery of mediterrean woods. The 360-degree panorama from mountains of the Serra Tramuntana, including the Bay of Palma and view of the city is really worth this walk.

places.name: City Sightseeing Palma de Mallorca

reviews.text: The city sightseeing bus is a must-do in Palma! We found Palma city to be quite limited, so the bus tour allows tourists to see the best bits. We joined the tour just across the road from Palma train station and purchased our tickets onboard. Prices were reasonable. There were loads of stops along the way, including a lovely drive up to Bellver Castle. The cathedral view from the bus was beautiful, which was when we departed the bus. The tour was informative and discussed the history of the city, but we felt that there was not much more to say about Palma city (not faulting City Sightseeing at all, just an observation about Palma City). The tour is definitely worthwhile.

It's definitely worth doing if you don't have a planned itinerary of things to do. It's a good way to see some of Mallorca quickly and handy about the fact that you can jump on and off for the whole day. What was not clear was the fact that there were some attractions I could visit for free with my ticket. However, I didn't think this was made clear enough by the person who sold me the ticket outside the Cathedral, so if you go, be sure to ask as you may miss out. I found being on top deck was the best place to sit, although this meant getting cooked alive in the process as the sun was on full blast the day i visited. Would be great if but had some shelter but open on the sides. These are some of the views I saw from the bus.

We were looking forward to use the HOHO bus in Palma. Very disapointed by their service. We purchases tickets at their local vendor, and when waiting for the bus at the first stop, we were told to wait on line eventhough we had the ticket. We waited for about one hour, and the behaviour of their staff was appropriate.

places.address: Av. de Gabriel Roca, 19, Entresuelo, Poniente, 07014 Palma, Balearic Islands, Spain

places.generalDescription: Museu d'Hist√≤ria de la Ciutat de Palma de Mallorca, located within Bellver Castle, offers a captivating journey through the history of Palma. The museum is housed in the castle's magnificent facilities and provides insights into the city's evolution from the Bronze Age to modern times. Visitors can explore informative exhibits spread across two floors of the fortress, delving into various historical periods.

sources.snippet: Today Bellver Castle is home to the Museu d‚ÄôHist√≤ria de la Ciutat (City History Museum) which chronicles the fascinating history of Palma and its stunning galleried central courtyard is the stage for a series of classical music concerts performed by the Balearic Symphony Orchestra each July.
sources.shortName: Bellver Castle | Castillo de Bellver | Castle in Palma

sources.snippet: The Castle also houses the Museu d‚ÄôHistoria de la Ciutat (City History Museum), perfect to help us understand the historical development of Palma under the Romans, the Moors and the Christians.
sources.shortName: Bellver Castle - The best views of Palma

places.name: Museu d'Hist√≤ria de la Ciutat de Palma de Mallorca

reviews.text:
(Translated by Google) On the first floor of Belver Castle is the Museum of the History of the City of Palma de Mallorca, in which you can visit an exposition dedicated to the evolution of the city, starting from the first settlers to the Middle Ages. It also includes a collection of classic sculptures by Cardinal Despuig
